english_text: Thank you so much, Chris. And it's truly a great honor to have the opportunity to come to this stage twice; I'm extremely grateful.
chinese_text: 非常谢谢，克里斯。的确非常荣幸 能有第二次站在这个台上的机会，我真是非常感激。

english_text: I have been blown away by this conference, and I want to thank all of you for the many nice comments about what I had to say the other night.
chinese_text: 这个会议真是让我感到惊叹不已，我还要谢谢你们留下的 关于我上次演讲的精彩评论

english_text: And I say that sincerely, partly because  I need that.  Put yourselves in my position.
chinese_text: 我是非常真诚的，部分原因是因为----我的确非常需要！ 你设身处地为我想想！

english_text: I flew on Air Force Two for eight years.
chinese_text: 我坐了8年的空军二号。
entities: [{'original_entity': 'Air Force Two', 'translated_entity': '空军二号', 'entity_type': 'PRODUCT'}, {'original_entity': 'eight years', 'translated_entity': '八年', 'entity_type': 'DATE'}]

english_text: Now I have to take off my shoes or boots to get on an airplane!
chinese_text: 不过现在上飞机前我则要脱掉我的鞋子

english_text: I'll tell you one quick story to illustrate what that's been like for me.
chinese_text: 我给你讲个小故事来形容我现在是什么样的

english_text: It's a true story -- every bit of this is true.
chinese_text: 这是个真实的故事--每一点都是如此。

english_text: Soon after Tipper and I left the --  White House --  we were driving from our home in Nashville to a little farm we have 50 miles east of Nashville.
chinese_text: 就在我和Tipper离开白宫稍后不久 -- -- 我们驱车从纳什维尔的家开到 我们在东边50里外的一个小农场--

english_text: Driving ourselves.
chinese_text: 自己开车

english_text: I know it sounds like a little thing to you, but -- I looked in the rear-view mirror and all of a sudden it just hit me.
chinese_text: 我知道这对你们来说是小事一桩，但是 ---- 正当我看着后视镜的时候，突然感到非常惊奇。

english_text: There was no motorcade back there.
chinese_text: 后面竟然没有车队。

english_text: You've heard of phantom limb pain?
chinese_text: 你们听过幻肢痛么？

english_text: This was a rented Ford Taurus.  It was dinnertime, and we started looking for a place to eat.
chinese_text: 这辆福特Taurus是租来的，这时刚好是晚饭的时候 我们就开始找吃饭的地方

english_text: We were on I-40. We got to Exit 238, Lebanon, Tennessee.
chinese_text: 我们在40号洲际公路上，要在238出口下到田纳西州的黎巴嫩市

english_text: We got off the exit, we found a Shoney's restaurant.
chinese_text: 我们从出口下来，开始寻找一家--我们找到了Shoney餐馆。

english_text: Low-cost family restaurant chain, for those of you who don't know it.
chinese_text: 你们有些人也许不知道，这是家低成本的家庭连锁餐厅

english_text: We went in and sat down at the booth, and the waitress came over, made a big commotion over Tipper.  She took our order, and then went to the couple in the booth next to us, and she lowered her voice so much, I had to really strain to hear what she was saying.
chinese_text: 我们走进去后坐在小亭子里，女服务员也走了过来。 我跟Tipper引起了一阵骚动。 她写单后走到我们旁边亭子里的一对情侣边， 然后她的声音变得非常小以至于我要竖起耳朵才能听到她在说什么

english_text: And she said "Yes, that's former Vice President Al Gore and his wife, Tipper."
chinese_text: 接着她说”是的，他们就是前副总统艾尔·戈尔和他的妻子Tipper。“

english_text: And the man said, "He's come down a long way, hasn't he?"
chinese_text: 那个男的接着说，“他已经非常努力了，不是吗？“

english_text: There's been kind of a series of epiphanies.
chinese_text: 已经算是有些显灵了。

english_text: The very next day, continuing the totally true story, I got on a G-V to fly to Africa to make a speech in Nigeria, in the city of Lagos, on the topic of energy.
chinese_text: 第二天，继续一个完全真实的故事。 我登上G-5就飞到非洲的尼尔利亚做演讲去了， 在首都拉各斯，主题则是关于能源。

english_text: And I began the speech by telling them the story of what had just happened the day before in Nashville.
chinese_text: 而演讲开始我则把前一天发生在纳什维尔州 的故事讲了一遍。

english_text: And I told it pretty much the same way I've just shared it with you: Tipper and I were driving ourselves, Shoney's, low-cost family restaurant chain, what the man said -- they laughed.
chinese_text: 就如同刚刚我给你们讲的故事一模一样。 我妻子和我自己开车，Shoney's餐馆，低成本家庭连锁餐厅 饭店那个男人的话--然后观众笑了

english_text: I gave my speech, then went back out to the airport to fly back home.
chinese_text: 演讲完后就开到飞机场飞回老家了

english_text: I fell asleep on the plane until, during the middle of the night, we landed on the Azores Islands for refueling.
chinese_text: 接着我就在飞机上睡着了，直到三更半夜才醒来， 飞机在亚速尔群岛降落加油。

english_text: I woke up, they opened the door, I went out to get some fresh air, and I looked, and there was a man running across the runway.
chinese_text: 我醒了过来，走出飞机去呼吸点新鲜空气， 然后我看到有个人跑过飞机跑道

english_text: And he was waving a piece of paper, and he was yelling, "Call Washington! Call Washington!"
chinese_text: 他一边挥舞着一张纸，一边大喊， ”打电话给华盛顿！打电话给华盛顿！“

english_text: And I thought to myself, in the middle of the night, in the middle of the Atlantic, what in the world could be wrong in Washington?
chinese_text: 然后我自己在那思考，三更半夜在大西洋的中心 那么华盛顿能有什么出错呢？
entities: [{'original_entity': 'the middle of the night', 'translated_entity': '夜中', 'entity_type': 'DATE'}, {'original_entity': 'Atlantic', 'translated_entity': '大西洋', 'entity_type': 'LOC'}, {'original_entity': 'Washington', 'translated_entity': '华盛顿', 'entity_type': 'GPE'}]

english_text: Then I remembered it could be a bunch of things.
chinese_text: 接下来我记起来原来还是有很多事情的。

english_text: But what it turned out to be, was that my staff was extremely upset because one of the wire services in Nigeria had already written a story about my speech, and it had already been printed in cities all across the United States of America.
chinese_text: 但是结果证明原来是我的员工的极度烦躁 因为尼尔利亚有一家通讯社已经把我的演讲写成一个故事 并且已经印出来在全美发行了

english_text: It was printed in Monterey, I checked.  And the story began, "Former Vice President Al Gore announced in Nigeria yesterday," quote: 'My wife Tipper and I have opened a low-cost family restaurant'" --  "'named Shoney's, and we are running it ourselves.'" Before I could get back to U.S. soil, David Letterman and Jay Leno had already started in on -- one of them had me in a big white chef's hat,
chinese_text: -- 我查过了是在蒙特利尔印刷的，而写的故事则是这样开头的， ”前副总统艾尔·戈尔前天在尼尔利亚声明， ‘我与我妻子Tipper开了一家低成本家庭连锁餐厅，名为Shoney's, 而且是有我们自己经营的。“ 在我回到美国本土前， 戴维莱特曼和杰伊莱诺已经开始在搞这些生意了 -- 他们中的一个人还让我戴了个很大的大厨帽呢，

english_text: Tipper was saying, "One more burger with fries!"
chinese_text: Tipper还说,"再来一个汉堡包加薯条！“

english_text: I got a nice, long, handwritten letter from my friend and partner and colleague Bill Clinton, saying, "Congratulations on the new restaurant, Al!"
chinese_text: 三天后，我从我的朋友兼伙伴兼同事比尔克林顿哪里收到一封 手写，精美兼很长的一封信，内容是，”艾尔，祝新餐馆开张！”

english_text: We like to celebrate each other's successes in life.
chinese_text: 我们喜欢在对方成功的时候互相祝福

english_text: I was going to talk about information ecology.
chinese_text: 我要谈一谈信息生态学。

english_text: But I was thinking that, since I plan to make a lifelong habit of coming back to TED, that maybe I could talk about that another time.  Chris Anderson: It's a deal!
chinese_text: 但是我又在想也许我可能计划把TED演讲当作我毕生的习惯， 那样的话也许我可以在其他的时候讲-指信息生态学（鼓掌） 克里斯 安德森： 一言为定！

english_text: Al Gore: I want to focus on what many of you have said What can you do about the climate crisis? I want to start with a couple of -- I'm going to show some new images, and I'm going to recapitulate just four or five.
chinese_text: 我现在主要想谈一谈你们最关心的问题 对于气候危机你可以做什么呢？我想从这点开始谈-- 我要给你们展示一些新的照片，当然还有四五张也需要要重新展示
entities: [{'original_entity': 'Al Gore', 'translated_entity': '阿尔·戈尔', 'entity_type': 'PERSON'}, {'original_entity': 'just four or five', 'translated_entity': '只有四个或五个', 'entity_type': 'CARDINAL'}]

english_text: Now, the slide show. I update the slide show every time I give it.
chinese_text: 现在看幻灯片，我每次都会更新这些幻灯片的。

english_text: I add new images, because I learn more about it every time I give it.
chinese_text: 我每次更新的时候都会加新的图片进去，其中也许到了许多新的。

english_text: It's like beach-combing, you know?
chinese_text: 就像那些在潮汐间隔的海滩中找宝物一般，

english_text: Every time the tide comes in and out, you find some more shells.
chinese_text: 你会找到更多的贝壳。

english_text: Just in the last two days, we got the new temperature records in January.
chinese_text: 刚刚在昨天，我们就得到了新的一月份的温度记录。

english_text: This is just for the United States of America. Historical average for Januarys is 31 degrees; last month was 39.5 degrees.
chinese_text: 这仅仅是美国的，一月份的历史平局记录是31度。 上个一月份是39.5度。

english_text: Now, I know that you wanted some more bad news about the environment -- I'm kidding. But these are the recapitulation slides, and then I'm going to go into new material about what you can do.
chinese_text: 现在，我知道你想要更多的关于环境的坏新闻 --只是个玩笑-- 但这些只是重述幻灯片， 然后我将会谈论关于你能做什么的新内容。

english_text: But I wanted to elaborate on a couple of these.
chinese_text: 但我想先说明下这些东西。

english_text: First of all, this is where we're projected to go with the U.S. contribution to global warming, under business as usual. Efficiency in end-use electricity and end-use of all energy is the low-hanging fruit. Efficiency and conservation -- it's not a cost; it's a profit.
chinese_text: 首先，这是我们估计到的关于美国对全球温室效应的贡献， 在普通情况下对于电力和能源的最终使用的效率 就像踮脚就能够着的果实，非常低的。 效率和对自然环境的保护：

english_text: The sign is wrong.
chinese_text: 不是成本，而是利润。 信号是错误的。

english_text: It's not negative; it's positive. These are investments that pay for themselves.
chinese_text: 不是负面效应，而是正面的。这些都是为自己支付的投资。

english_text: But they are also very effective in deflecting our path.
chinese_text: 但是它们在转移我们思想的时候也是非常有效的。

english_text: Cars and trucks -- I talked about that in the slideshow, but I want you to put it in perspective.
chinese_text: 汽车和火车--我在上次幻灯片的时候谈到过， 但是我希望你们能够先思考一下。

english_text: It's an easy, visible target of concern -- and it should be -- but there is more global warming pollution that comes from buildings than from cars and trucks.
chinese_text: 这应该是我们所忧虑的目标里比较容易和显而易见的一个了， 但是相对于汽车和货车，对于全球温室效应的污染则更多 来自于建筑物。

english_text: Cars and trucks are very significant, and we have the lowest standards in the world.
chinese_text: 汽车和货车是非常明显的，因为我们的标准是全世界最低的。

english_text: And so we should address that. But it's part of the puzzle.
chinese_text: 这样的话我们应该解决这个问题，但是这又是个伤脑筋的难题。

english_text: Other transportation efficiency is as important as cars and trucks.
chinese_text: 其他交通工具的效率当然也应和汽车货车一样！

english_text: Renewables at the current levels of technological efficiency can make this much difference. And with what Vinod, and John Doerr and others, many of you here -- there are a lot of people directly involved in this -- this wedge is going to grow much more rapidly than the current projection shows it.
chinese_text: 可再生能源目前水平的技术效率 可以大大的改变现状， 而且还有维诺德和约翰·多尔等等 你们中的许多人直接参与其中 --这个楔形的成长要比我们目前所预计的要迅速的多。

english_text: Carbon Capture and Sequestration -- that's what CCS stands for -- is likely to become the killer app that will enable us to continue to use fossil fuels in a way that is safe.
chinese_text: 碳捕捉及封存技术--就是CCS代表的意思 --很有可能变成杀手级的应用 它将使我们能够继续安全的使用矿物燃料。
entities: [{'original_entity': 'Carbon Capture and Sequestration', 'translated_entity': '碳捕获和储存', 'entity_type': 'ORG'}, {'original_entity': 'CCS', 'translated_entity': 'CCS', 'entity_type': 'ORG'}]

english_text: Not quite there yet.
chinese_text: 不过技术上还不是非常的成熟。

english_text: OK. Now, what can you do? Reduce emissions in your home.
chinese_text: OK,现在，你在家里可以做什么来减少排放呢？

english_text: Most of these expenditures are also profitable.
chinese_text: 大多数这些支出也是有利可图的。

english_text: Insulation, better design. Buy green electricity where you can.
chinese_text: 尽可能的购买绝缘，更优设计和绿色电力的产品。

english_text: I mentioned automobiles -- buy a hybrid. Use light rail.
chinese_text: 如同我提到的汽车--购买混合动力或者坐轻轨。

english_text: Figure out some of the other options that are much better. It's important.
chinese_text: 想出一些其他更好的替代方案，这是非常重要的。

english_text: Be a green consumer. You have choices with everything you buy, between things that have a harsh effect, or a much less harsh effect on the global climate crisis.
chinese_text: 成为一个环保消费者，对于你买的所有东西都要选择， 比较哪个产品对于全球气候危机的影响大

english_text: Consider this: Make a decision to live a carbon-neutral life.
chinese_text: 还是小 考虑这点，下决心去拥有一个碳中性的生活。

english_text: Those of you who are good at branding, I'd love to get your advice and help on how to say this in a way that connects with the most people.
chinese_text: 对于你们中那些熟悉品牌运作的人， 我希望可以从你们那里得到建议和帮助 关于如何让人知道这是关乎大多数人的利益。

english_text: It is easier than you think. It really is.
chinese_text: 这比你想象的要容易些，真的。

english_text: A lot of us in here have made that decision, and it is really pretty easy.
chinese_text: 你们中的许多人已经做出了合适的决定，这真的是相当容易。

english_text: It means reduce your carbon dioxide emissions with the full range of choices that you make, and then purchase or acquire offsets for the remainder that you have not completely reduced. And what it means is elaborated at climatecrisis.net.
chinese_text: 在做各种选择前尽量选那些可以减少二氧化碳排放量的， 而且还要对那些没做到的决定作出合适的补偿 具体什么意思可以看 climatecrisis.net 网站上的说明。

english_text: There is a carbon calculator. Participant Productions convened -- with my active involvement -- the leading software writers in the world, on this arcane science of carbon calculation, to construct a consumer-friendly carbon calculator.
chinese_text: 哪里有个碳排量计算器。可以计算你的碳排放量。 由于我积极的参与其中，全球最棒的软件设计师 根据碳排放的计算公式设计出这个 非常友好的碳排放计算器.

english_text: You can very precisely calculate what your CO2 emissions are, and then you will be given options to reduce.
chinese_text: 你可以非常精确的计算出你的碳排放量. 然后还会给出如何减少碳排放的建议.

english_text: And by the time the movie comes out in May, this will be updated to 2.0, and we will have click-through purchases of offsets.
chinese_text: 等五月份电影出来的时候,这个版本也会升级到2.0. 更新中包括能够购买碳排放抵消的功能

english_text: Next, consider making your business carbon-neutral. Again, some of us have done that, and it's not as hard as you think. Integrate climate solutions into all of your innovations, whether you are from the technology, or entertainment, or design and architecture community.
chinese_text: 接下来，关于如何使你的商业碳中和化，当然，我们中的许多人已经做到了。 其实这不是你想的那么难，只要把气候危机解决方案融入到所有的革新当中。 不管你是处于科技领域或娱乐事业， 或设计行业和社区建筑。

english_text: Invest sustainably. Majora mentioned this.
chinese_text: 持续的投资，姆吉拉提及过这个。

english_text: Listen, if you have invested money with managers who you compensate on the basis of their annual performance, don't ever again complain about quarterly report CEO management.
chinese_text: 听着，如果你必须要和一个他的报酬是基于 年度绩效的经理人的话。 别再抱怨季度报告里关于首席执行官的管理

english_text: Over time, people do what you pay them to do.
chinese_text: 久而久之，人们会做你付钱让他们去做的事，而且如果他们断定

english_text: And if they judge how much they're going to get paid on your capital that they've invested, based on the short-term returns, you're going to get short-term decisions.
chinese_text: 基于他们投资的多少而获得多少的话。 根据短期回报率，你必须做出短期决策。

english_text: A lot more to be said about that.
chinese_text: 关于这个有太多需要说了。

english_text: Become a catalyst of change. Teach others, learn about it, talk about it.
chinese_text: 成为一个促进改变的人，教导其他人，学习它，讨论它。

english_text: The movie is a movie version of the slideshow I gave two nights ago, except it's a lot more entertaining.
chinese_text: 关于电影发行--其实电影只是这个幻灯片我2天前演讲的的电影版本 除了电影比较更具娱乐性，电影在五月份发行。

english_text: And it comes out in May. Many of you here have the opportunity to ensure that a lot of people see it.
chinese_text: 你们中的许多人有机会可以让更多的人去看这个电影。

english_text: Consider sending somebody to Nashville.
chinese_text: 考虑送一些人去纳什维尔看。

english_text: Pick well. And I am personally going to train people to give this slideshow -- re-purposed, with some of the personal stories obviously replaced with a generic approach, and it's not just the slides, it's what they mean. And it's how they link together.
chinese_text: 然后我个人也会训练一些人去做这个演讲，重新利用. 其中的一些明显的个人故事只好用一般方法代替了。 当然不只只是这些幻灯片，而是它们蕴含的意思以及如何使他们联系起来。

english_text: And so I'm going to be conducting a course this summer for a group of people that are nominated by different folks in communities all across the country, and we're going to update the slideshow for all of them every single week, to keep it right on the cutting edge.
chinese_text: 这样的话我就会在今年夏天带一个课程 给那帮获得提名的人们上一课。 全体的，在全国各地的社区， 每个星期我们也会为他们更新这些幻灯片 来保证资料都处在最前沿。
entities: [{'original_entity': 'this summer', 'translated_entity': '这个夏天', 'entity_type': 'DATE'}, {'original_entity': 'every single week', 'translated_entity': '每星期', 'entity_type': 'DATE'}]

english_text: Working with Larry Lessig, it will be, somewhere in that process, posted with tools and limited-use copyrights, so that young people can remix it and do it in their own way.
chinese_text: 和拉里·莱斯格一起工作，那会是，在过程中的某个阶段。 用工具和限量使用版权来张贴， 那样的话年轻人就可以用他们自己的方法重新制作。

english_text: Where did anybody get the idea that you ought to stay arm's length from politics?
chinese_text: 人们都是从哪里得知应该跟政治保持距离呢？

english_text: It doesn't mean that if you're a Republican, that I'm trying to convince you to be a Democrat.
chinese_text: 这无关你是否是共和党人然后我要说服你变成一个民主党人士。

english_text: We need Republicans as well. This used to be a bipartisan issue, and I know that in this group it really is. Become politically active.
chinese_text: 我们也需要共和党人。这是个两党连立的问题， 据我所知这在我们这个团体里面的确是如此的。变成政治活跃人士。

english_text: Make our democracy work the way it's supposed to work.
chinese_text: 使我们的民主照着原本应该的方式来运作。

english_text: Support the idea of capping carbon dioxide emissions -- global warming pollution -- and trading it.
chinese_text: 支持关于二氧化碳排放和全球温室效应污染的理念，

english_text: Here's why: as long as the United States is out of the world system, it's not a closed system.
chinese_text: 并且补偿这一切，这是因为，由于美国在这个世界体系之外， 但是这又不是个封闭的体系。

english_text: Once it becomes a closed system, with U.S. participation, then everybody who's on a board of directors -- how many people here serve on the board of directors of a corporation?
chinese_text: 但是一旦它变成了封闭的体系，不管美国是否参与， 那样的话每个人都成为董事会成员了 --这里有多少人是公司里面的董事会成员呢？

english_text: Once it's a closed system, you will have legal liability if you do not urge your CEO to get the maximum income from reducing and trading the carbon emissions that can be avoided.
chinese_text: 一旦它成为一个封闭的体系，你将背负法律上的责任如果你不督促你的CEO 从减少和补偿可以避免的碳排放方面获得最大的收入。

english_text: The market will work to solve this problem -- if we can accomplish this.
chinese_text: 如果我们能够实现它的话那么市场先生将会自己去解决这个问题。

english_text: Help with the mass persuasion campaign that will start this spring.
chinese_text: 从今年春天开始的大众劝说运动的帮助。

english_text: We have to change the minds of the American people.
chinese_text: 我们必须去改变美国人民的观念。

english_text: Because presently, the politicians do not have permission to do what needs to be done.
chinese_text: 因为现在的政治不允许去做一些需要做的事。

english_text: And in our modern country, the role of logic and reason no longer includes mediating between wealth and power the way it once did.
chinese_text: 在一个现代化国家，逻辑和理性的作用已不再只包括 以前所做的关于财富和权力的调解。

english_text: It's now repetition of short, hot-button, 30-second, 28-second television ads.
chinese_text: 现在已经是短的，热门的，30秒，28秒的电视广告的重复播放。

english_text: We have to buy a lot of those ads.
chinese_text: 我们必须要买许多这样的广告。

english_text: Let's re-brand global warming, as many of you have suggested.
chinese_text: 让我们把全球变暖这个品牌重新包装一下，就如许多人建议的那样。

english_text: I like "climate crisis" instead of "climate collapse," but again, those of you who are good at branding, I need your help on this.
chinese_text: 相对于气候崩溃我更喜欢气候危机这个叫法， 老调重谈一下，如果你们谁对品牌运作方面相当在行的话，我需要你们的帮助。

english_text: Somebody said the test we're facing now, a scientist told me, is whether the combination of an opposable thumb and a neocortex is a viable combination.
chinese_text: 有个科学家告诉我，有人说我们现在面对的检验是， 对生拇指和新皮层的组合是否是 一种可以实行的组合。

english_text: That's really true. I said the other night, and I'll repeat now: this is not a political issue.
chinese_text: 这是真的。上次我也说过了，但是我现在再重复一次：这不是政治问题。

english_text: Again, the Republicans here -- this shouldn't be partisan.
chinese_text: 今天来的共和党人们，这不应该是党派性的。

english_text: You have more influence than some of us who are Democrats do.
chinese_text: 你甚至比在我们这里的有些共和党人更加具有影响力。

english_text: This is an opportunity. Not just this, but connected to the ideas that are here, to bring more coherence to them.
chinese_text: 这不止是个很好的机会，更可以把今天我们在这里的想法连接到 并一致的带给其他人。

english_text: We are one.
chinese_text: 我们是整体。

english_text: Thank you very much, I appreciate it.
chinese_text: 谢谢感谢，我非常的感激。

english_text: In terms of invention, I'd like to tell you the tale of one of my favorite projects.
chinese_text: 说到发明 我想跟你们说说我最得意的一个项目

english_text: I think it's one of the most exciting that I'm working on, but I think it's also the simplest.
chinese_text: 我觉得它是我现在做的最令我兴奋的项目 同时也是最简单的一个

english_text: It's a project that has the potential to make a huge impact around the world.
chinese_text: 这个项目很可能极大地影响世界

english_text: It addresses one of the biggest health issues on the planet, the number one cause of death in children under five.
chinese_text: 它能解决目前世界上最严重的健康问题之一 这个问题是5岁以下儿童死亡的头号杀手

english_text: Which is ...? Water-borne diseases? Diarrhea? Malnutrition?
chinese_text: 是什么呢？ 水媒传染疾病？痢疾？营养不良？

english_text: No. It's breathing the smoke from indoor cooking fires -- acute respiratory infections caused by this. Can you believe that?
chinese_text: 都不对，是吸入厨房油烟 导致急性呼吸道感染，你相信吗？

english_text: I find this shocking and somewhat appalling.
chinese_text: 我感到很震惊也很可怕

english_text: Can't we make cleaner burning cooking fuels?
chinese_text: 我们能否发明更清洁的炊事燃料？

english_text: Can't we make better stoves?
chinese_text: 更好的炉灶？

english_text: How is it that this can lead to over two million deaths every year?
chinese_text: 这个问题为何每年能杀死200多万人呢？
entities: [{'original_entity': 'over two million', 'translated_entity': '超过两百万人', 'entity_type': 'CARDINAL'}, {'original_entity': 'every year', 'translated_entity': '每年', 'entity_type': 'DATE'}]

english_text: I know Bill Joy was talking to you about the wonders of carbon nanotubes, so I'm going to talk to you about the wonders of carbon macro-tubes, which is charcoal.  So this is a picture of rural Haiti. Haiti is now 98 percent deforested.
chinese_text: 我知道Bill Joy和大家讲过 碳纳管的奇妙之处 那今天我就和大家讲讲 大碳管也就是木炭的妙用 这是一张海地乡村的照片，海地国土面积的98%如今都没有森林覆盖了
entities: [{'original_entity': 'Bill Joy', 'translated_entity': '比尔·乔伊', 'entity_type': 'PERSON'}, {'original_entity': 'Haiti', 'translated_entity': '海地', 'entity_type': 'GPE'}, {'original_entity': 'Haiti', 'translated_entity': '海地', 'entity_type': 'GPE'}, {'original_entity': '98 percent', 'translated_entity': '98%', 'entity_type': 'PERCENT'}]

english_text: You'll see scenes like this all over the island.
chinese_text: 整个海地岛屿都是这幅景象

english_text: It leads to all sorts of environmental problems and problems that affect people throughout the nation.
chinese_text: 这造成了各种环境问题 以及一些影响海地人民的其他问题

english_text: A couple years ago there was severe flooding that led to thousands of deaths -- that's directly attributable to the fact that there are no trees on the hills to stabilize the soil.
chinese_text: 几年前一场洪水肆虐 夺走了几千人的生命 这都是因为 山上没有树来巩固土壤

english_text: So the rains come -- they go down the rivers and the flooding happens.
chinese_text: 所以一旦下雨，雨水混杂泥土直接冲入河流，造成洪灾

english_text: Now one of the reasons why there are so few trees is this: people need to cook, and they harvest wood and they make charcoal in order to do it.
chinese_text: 这里没树主要是因为 人们烧饭需要燃料 于是人们把木材做成木炭

english_text: It's not that people are ignorant to the environmental damage.
chinese_text: 并不是海地人不重视环境保护

english_text: They know perfectly well, but they have no other choice.
chinese_text: 他们明白环境重要，但是他们无可奈何

english_text: Fossil fuels are not available, and solar energy doesn't cook the way that they like their food prepared.
chinese_text: 这里没有化石燃料 太阳能也不是很好用

english_text: And so this is what they do.
chinese_text: 所以这也算是无奈之举

english_text: You'll find families like this who go out into the forest to find a tree, cut it down and make charcoal out of it.
chinese_text: 你常能看到这样一家人一起去森林里 砍了树，再做成木炭

english_text: So not surprisingly, there's a lot of effort that's been done to look at alternative cooking fuels.
chinese_text: 毫无疑问，人们已经很努力 找寻这种燃料的替代品了

english_text: About four years ago, I took a team of students down to Haiti and we worked with Peace Corps volunteers there.
chinese_text: 4年前，我和一群学生去海地 和当地的和平队志愿者一起工作
entities: [{'original_entity': 'About four years ago', 'translated_entity': '大约四年前', 'entity_type': 'DATE'}, {'original_entity': 'Haiti', 'translated_entity': '海地', 'entity_type': 'GPE'}, {'original_entity': 'Peace Corps', 'translated_entity': '和平部队', 'entity_type': 'ORG'}]

english_text: This is one such volunteer and this is a device that he had built in the village where he worked.
chinese_text: 有一个志愿者 在他呆的村庄里发明了这个小玩意儿

english_text: And the idea was that you could take waste paper; you could compress it and make briquettes that could be used for fuel.
chinese_text: 就是把废纸 压缩成块状用来燃烧

english_text: But this device was very slow.
chinese_text: 但是它烧得很慢

english_text: So our engineering students went to work on it and with some very simple changes, they were able to triple the throughput of this device.
chinese_text: 我们工程系的学生就拿来改良了一下 做了一点小改动之后 它的效率提高了3倍

english_text: So you could imagine they were very excited about it.
chinese_text: 他们当时非常激动

english_text: And they took the briquettes back to MIT so that they could test them.
chinese_text: 后来他们还把这些纸砖块带回麻省大学做测试

english_text: And one of the things that they found was they didn't burn.
chinese_text: 结果却发现这些东西不能燃烧

english_text: So it was a little discouraging to the students.
chinese_text: 学生们都挺失望的

english_text: And in fact, if you look closely, right here you can see it says, "US Peace Corps."
chinese_text: 如果你仔细看，在这儿， 你就会发现“美国和平队”字样

english_text: As it turns out, there actually wasn't any waste paper in this village.
chinese_text: 因为在那个村庄里根本没废纸

english_text: And while it was a good use of government paperwork for this volunteer to bring it back with him to his village, it was 800 kilometers away.
chinese_text: 或许这仪器用来处理政府文书倒是挺好的 让那个志愿者把政府文书带回到那个村子 不过政府机关离那个村子有足足800公里之遥

english_text: And so we thought perhaps there might be a better way to come up with an alternative cooking fuel.
chinese_text: 所以我们就想琢磨个更好的办法 来制造炊事燃料的替代品

english_text: What we wanted to do is we wanted to make a fuel that used something that was readily available on the local level.
chinese_text: 我们希望这种新燃料 能就地取材

english_text: You see these all over Haiti as well. They're small-scale sugar mills.
chinese_text: 海地到处都有小规模的制糖厂

english_text: And the waste product from them after you extract the juice from the sugarcane is called "bagasse."
chinese_text: 这些厂的废料 也就是榨完甘蔗之后剩下的东西叫“甘蔗渣”

english_text: It has no nutritional value, so they don't feed it to the animals.
chinese_text: 这个没啥用，也没营养价值 当饲料都不够好

english_text: It just sits in a pile near the sugar mill until eventually they burn it.
chinese_text: 人们就把成堆的甘蔗渣堆在制糖厂外，最后拿来烧掉

english_text: What we wanted to do was we wanted to find a way to harness this waste resource and turn it into a fuel that would be something that people could easily cook with, something like charcoal.
chinese_text: 而我们就想 变废为宝 把那些甘蔗渣做成人人都能方便使用的燃料 就像木炭一样

english_text: So over the next couple of years, students and I worked to develop a process.
chinese_text: 接下来的几年时间里，我和我的学生就在开发合适的生产工艺
entities: [{'original_entity': 'the next couple of years', 'translated_entity': '接下来的几年', 'entity_type': 'DATE'}]

english_text: So you start with the bagasse, and then you take a very simple kiln that you can make out of a waste fifty five-gallon oil drum.
chinese_text: 首先我们把甘蔗渣放入一个窑炉 这种炉子很好做，拿一个废弃的55加仑容积的油桶就可以改装了

english_text: After some time, after setting it on fire, you seal it to restrict the oxygen that goes into the kiln, and then you end up with this carbonized material here.
chinese_text: 然后我们点燃甘蔗渣，让它烧一小会儿以后就把炉封好 不要让空气进去 最后就制成了这种炭化材料

english_text: However, you can't burn this.
chinese_text: 但是，这个不好用，因为颗粒太细了

english_text: It's too fine and it burns too quickly to be useful for cooking.
chinese_text: 用来烧饭的话一下就烧完了

english_text: So we had to try to find a way to form it into useful briquettes.
chinese_text: 所以我们就设法把它压缩成块

english_text: And conveniently, one of my students was from Ghana, and he remembered a dish his mom used to make for him called "kokonte," which is a very sticky porridge made out of the cassava root.
chinese_text: 正好，我的一个学生是加纳人 记得他母亲给他做过一道菜叫“木薯糊” 就是用木薯的根烧成的很稠的粥

english_text: And so what we did was we looked, and we found that cassava is indeed grown in Haiti, under the name of "manioc."
chinese_text: 于是我们就四下寻找 发现海地也种植木薯，只不过叫法不同

english_text: In fact, it's grown all over the world -- yucca, tapioca, manioc, cassava, it's all the same thing -- a very starchy root vegetable.
chinese_text: 其实世界上很多地方都有木薯 虽然名称各异，东西都是一样的 就是含淀粉的食用其块状根的植物

english_text: And you can make a very thick, sticky porridge out of it, which you can use to bind together the charcoal briquettes.
chinese_text: 你可以把它做成糊 再用这个糊把木炭块粘在一起

english_text: So we did this. We went down to Haiti.
chinese_text: 我们就这么做了。 后来我们又去海地

english_text: These are the graduates of the first Ecole de Charbon, or Charcoal Institute.
chinese_text: 这些研究生就是第一所 木炭学院的学生
entities: [{'original_entity': 'first', 'translated_entity': '首先', 'entity_type': 'ORDINAL'}, {'original_entity': 'Ecole de Charbon', 'translated_entity': '埃科勒·德·', 'entity_type': 'ORG'}, {'original_entity': 'Charcoal Institute', 'translated_entity': '石炭研究所', 'entity_type': 'ORG'}]

english_text: That's right. So I'm actually an instructor at MIT as well as CIT.
chinese_text: 没错，所以我既是麻省理工的导师也是木碳学院的导师

english_text: And these are the briquettes that we made.
chinese_text: 这些就是我们做的炭砖

english_text: Now I'm going to take you to a different continent. This is India and this is the most commonly used cooking fuel in India. It's cow dung.
chinese_text: 现在我们到亚洲再来看看印度 这是印度最常见的炊事燃料——牛粪

english_text: And more than in Haiti, this produces really smoky fires, and this is where you see the health impacts of cooking with cow dung and biomass as a fuel.
chinese_text: 这产生的油烟比海地的还厉害 你看，健康问题 就是因为燃烧牛粪或其他生物燃料造成的

english_text: Kids and women are especially affected by it, because they're the ones who are around the cooking fires.
chinese_text: 儿童和妇女尤受影响 因为他们经常在厨房里转悠

english_text: So we wanted to see if we could introduce this charcoal-making technology there.
chinese_text: 我们想看看是否能引进 之前的制炭技术

english_text: Well, unfortunately, they didn't have sugarcane and they didn't have cassava, but that didn't stop us.
chinese_text: 可惜，印度没甘蔗 也没木薯，但这些都难不倒我们

english_text: What we did was we found what were the locally available sources of biomass.
chinese_text: 我们还是就地取材

english_text: And there was wheat straw and there was rice straw in this area.
chinese_text: 用这里的麦秆和稻秆加工成燃料

english_text: And what we could use as a binder was actually small amounts of cow manure, which they used ordinarily for their fuel.
chinese_text: 至于粘合剂 就用少量的牛粪 而原本这些牛粪都是直接做燃料的

english_text: And we did side-by-side tests, and here you can see the charcoal briquettes and here the cow dung.
chinese_text: 我们做了些对比试验，大家可以看到 炭砖和牛粪做对比

english_text: And you can see that it's a lot cleaner burning of a cooking fuel.
chinese_text: 很明显炭砖清洁得多

english_text: And in fact, it heats the water a lot more quickly.
chinese_text: 而且烧水速度也快很多

english_text: And so we were very happy, thus far.
chinese_text: 所以我们都很开心

english_text: But one of the things that we found was when we did side-by-side comparisons with wood charcoal, it didn't burn as long. And the briquettes crumbled a little bit and we lost energy as they fell apart as they were cooking.
chinese_text: 但是我们发现 和一般木炭比 炭砖不持久，一下就碎了 于是热量就分散开来，导致烧饭的时候很费力

english_text: So we wanted to try to find a way to make a stronger briquette so that we could compete with wood charcoal in the markets in Haiti.
chinese_text: 我们就想办法把炭砖做得更紧实 这样就能和海地市场上的木炭竞争了

english_text: So we went back to MIT, we took out the Instron machine and we figured out what sort of forces you needed in order to compress a briquette to the level that you actually are getting improved performance out of it?
chinese_text: 我们回到麻省，找出英斯特朗电子强力测试仪 分析出用多少压缩力度 压缩出的炭砖 会有一个质的飞跃

english_text: And at the same time that we had students in the lab looking at this, we also had community partners in Haiti working to develop the process, to improve it and make it more accessible to people in the villages there.
chinese_text: 一方面我的学生们在实验室里研究 一方面海地的社区伙伴也同我们合作 努力改良炭砖，让人人都用得上

english_text: And after some time, we developed a low-cost press that allows you to produce charcoal, actually, it burns longer, cleaner than wood charcoal.
chinese_text: 一段时间之后 我们发明了低成本制木炭法，新的产品 比一般木炭燃烧更持久也更清洁

english_text: So now we're in a situation where we have a product, which is actually better than what you can buy in Haiti in the marketplace, which is a very wonderful place to be.
chinese_text: 所以我们现在就有一个 比海地市场上的木炭更好的产品 这是一个很好的状况

english_text: In Haiti alone, about 30 million trees are cut down every year.
chinese_text: 仅海地一国，每年就有3000万棵树被砍伐
entities: [{'original_entity': 'Haiti', 'translated_entity': '海地', 'entity_type': 'GPE'}, {'original_entity': 'about 30 million', 'translated_entity': '大约有三千万人', 'entity_type': 'CARDINAL'}, {'original_entity': 'every year', 'translated_entity': '每年', 'entity_type': 'DATE'}]

english_text: There's a possibility of this being implemented and saving a good portion of those.
chinese_text: 这个产品如果能得到应用 能救很多树

english_text: In addition, the revenue generated from that charcoal is 260 million dollars.
chinese_text: 另外，这种新木炭每年能创收2.6亿美元

english_text: That's an awful lot for a country like Haiti -- with a population of eight million and an average income of less than 400 dollars.
chinese_text: 这可是一大笔钱 海地人口800万 人均收入不足400美元
entities: [{'original_entity': 'Haiti', 'translated_entity': '海地', 'entity_type': 'GPE'}, {'original_entity': 'eight million', 'translated_entity': '八百万', 'entity_type': 'CARDINAL'}, {'original_entity': 'less than 400 dollars', 'translated_entity': '不到400美元', 'entity_type': 'MONEY'}]

english_text: So this is where we're also moving ahead with our charcoal project.
chinese_text: 因此我们想在海地继续这个木炭项目

english_text: And one of the things that I think is also interesting, is I have a friend up at UC Berkeley who's been doing risk analysis.
chinese_text: 还有一件有意思的事情是 我有个朋友在伯克利大学是做风险研究的

english_text: And he's looked at the problem of the health impacts of burning wood versus charcoal.
chinese_text: 他研究了对健康 木材和木炭分别会造成什么影响 他发现只要改用木炭作燃料

english_text: And he's found that worldwide, you could prevent a million deaths switching from wood to charcoal as a cooking fuel.
chinese_text: 在世界范围内就能有100万人可以幸免于难 这真是很棒 本来做木炭都是需要木材的

english_text: But now we have a way that's using an agricultural waste material to create a cooking fuel.
chinese_text: 但现在我们能 变农业废物为炊事燃料

english_text: One of the really exciting things, though, is something that came out of the trip that I took to Ghana just last month.
chinese_text: 最让人激动的是 上个月我去加纳时了解到的一个信息
entities: [{'original_entity': 'One', 'translated_entity': '一个', 'entity_type': 'CARDINAL'}, {'original_entity': 'Ghana', 'translated_entity': '加纳', 'entity_type': 'GPE'}, {'original_entity': 'just last month', 'translated_entity': '就在上个月', 'entity_type': 'DATE'}]

english_text: And I think it's the coolest thing, and it's even lower tech than what you just saw, if you can imagine such a thing. Here it is.
chinese_text: 这个不但非常酷 而且在技术层面上也比前面的那些更简单 如果你们能想象的到的话。就是这个。

english_text: So what is this? This is corncobs turned into charcoal.
chinese_text: 这是什么呢？这是把玉米棒做成木炭

english_text: And the beauty of this is that you don't need to form briquettes -- it comes ready made. This is my $100 laptop, right here.
chinese_text: 这个的好处就是你都不需要把炭压缩成块 因为玉米棒本来就是一块块的。 这就是我的100美元手提电脑项目了

english_text: And actually, like Nick, I brought samples.
chinese_text: 和尼克一样，我也带了样品给大家

english_text: So we can pass these around.
chinese_text: 大家相互传一下

english_text: They're fully functional, field-tested, ready to roll out.
chinese_text: 很好用，经过测试，能立刻燃烧

english_text: which is also remarkable about this technology, is that the technology transfer is so easy.
chinese_text: 这项技术妙在 容易转让

english_text: Compared to the sugarcane charcoal, where we have to teach people how to form it into briquettes and you have the extra step of cooking the binder, And this is about the most exciting thing in my life right now, which is perhaps a sad commentary on my life.
chinese_text: 就甘蔗木炭而言 我们要培训当地人如何压缩木炭 还要多出一步制粘合剂 玉米棒木炭自己成型，不需经过压缩的步骤 而这是我一生中最让我激动的事了 也是我一个小小的遗憾的注脚

english_text: But once you see it, like you guys in the front row -- All right, yeah, OK.
chinese_text: 但是一旦你见过，就像第一排的人 恩，对，反正
